segments.text: The little boy is stretching dangerously toward the cookie jar, and my heart races.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t understand how their mother can’t see what’s happening just a few feet away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It seems like such a small thing to take a cookie, yet it feels so risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle grows larger by the moment and not a single person seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks hopeful, as if she believes that cookie will be hers soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but think about the possible consequences of the boy’s actions.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he slips and falls? Will anyone even notice before it’s too late?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sight of the water cascading over the cabinet is startling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, the woman continues polishing that plate, unfazed by the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene feels like a ticking time bomb; something is bound to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
